intro: Piptocarpha jonesiana, commonly known as Jones' globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its globular shape, with numerous small yellow flowers clustered around a central stem. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it well adapted to drought conditions, with thick leaves and deep roots.
